sentences.sentence: What the emerging field of candidates says about the future of the Republican Party.Listen to and follow 'Matter of Opinion'Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Stitcher|Amazon MusicIt's 77 weeks before Election Day and over half a dozen people have already thrown their hats into the G.O.P.

On our new podcast, “Matter of Opinion,” Michelle Cottle, Ross Douthat, Carlos Lozada and Lydia Polgreen take a tour of the 2024 Republican primary field to understand what it takes to survive in the present-day Republican ecosystem ᅳ and maybe even beat the Trump in the room.Thoughts?
Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.comor leave us a voice mail message at (212) 556-7440.

We may use excerpts from your message in a future episode.By leaving us a message, you are agreeing to be governed by ourreader submission termsand agreeing that we may use and allow others to use your name, voice and message.Follow our hosts on Twitter: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT), Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT) and Lydia Polgreen (@lpolgreen).“Matter of Opinion” was produced this week by Phoebe Lett, Sophia Alvarez Boyd and Derek Arthur.
It was edited by Stephanie Joyce and Annie-Rose Strasser.
Original music by Pat McCusker, Sonia Herrero, Isaac Jones and Carole Sabouraud.
Special thanks to Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski.PHOTO: (PHOTOGRAPH BY Photograph by Scott Olson/Getty FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: What the emerging field of candidates says about the future of the Republican Party.Listen to and follow ‘Matter of Opinion’Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Stitcher|Amazon MusicIt’s 77 weeks before Election Day and over half a dozen people have already thrown their hats into the G.O.P. race. On our new podcast, “Matter of Opinion,” Michelle Cottle, Ross Douthat, Carlos Lozada and Lydia Polgreen take a tour of the 2024 Republican primary field to understand what it takes to survive in the present-day Republican ecosystem — and maybe even beat the Trump in the room.Thoughts? Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.comor leave us a voice mail message at (212) 556-7440. We may use excerpts from your message in a future episode.By leaving us a message, you are agreeing to be governed by ourreader submission termsand agreeing that we may use and allow others to use your name, voice and message.Follow our hosts on Twitter: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT), Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT) and Lydia Polgreen (@lpolgreen).“Matter of Opinion” was produced this week by Phoebe Lett, Sophia Alvarez Boyd and Derek Arthur. It was edited by Stephanie Joyce and Annie-Rose Strasser. Mixing by Pat McCusker. Original music by Pat McCusker, Sonia Herrero, Isaac Jones and Carole Sabouraud. Fact-checking by Mary Marge Locker. Special thanks to Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski.PHOTO:  (PHOTOGRAPH BY Photograph by Scott Olson/Getty FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)
